page.title: 01Rossall Point
page.content: Our area of 12 square kilometres contained 11 square kilometres of sea, part of the Irish Sea, and only one of land. This area is known as Rossall Point. The land is flat and wind-swept. There are no trees to be seen. The golf course, the cemetery and the most prestigous houses are the obvious features of the area. This area was originally covered with rabbit warrens before becoming a training ground for the Lancashire Regiment in the later half of the nineteenth century. Rossalll Point has a fine beach and very bracing air.
